name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: Wow! Loving all these replies. Sounds like my twitter friends make time for the right things in life!!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @HR_Manojkumar Sleep is a GREAT answer

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @dr_babu oh but you must! Making time for yourself makes you more present for those you love!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @tommanning00 This is an important lesson - especially right now when we're all so busy, and distracted by our phones

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @ddey67 Yes! Never underestimate the importance of a good laugh!//t.co/JIDqaIkKzt

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @MangeshBind absolutely

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @KunalShelat Yes! spending time on your own wellbeing means you can be more present and more 'there' for your friends, family and colleagues

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @AnikMichaud The second part is key isn't it! It's why I rarely check emails in the day time - I like to be fully present for my meetings.

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @lsmurthy99 Love this! I have a gratitude journal I write with my son every day. it's so important to take stock and take time to be mindful.

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @rucsb YES! So important!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @srinathagathsya As long as you're not gardening in Bangalore traffic!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @rucsb LOVE IT!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: Everybody has time for things they think are important. I want to be a good parent so I find time. I want to be a good leader, I make time for my people. It isn't easy, but it's about choosing what matters. What do you make time for? I'd love to hear from you! #LeenaLifeLessons

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: It doesn't matter what job you do, you can make a difference and you can spark another person's interests and passions. If you think how you can be of service to the people around you, you can be a true inspiration, whatever your role or level. #MondayMo//t.co/R3kzvvZNzd//t.co/0Gl9OdMMai

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: If I assume that my experience of the last 25 yrs is going to help me be successful in the next few, I'm wrong! That experience is becoming less and less worthy. What's important is how are we learning the things we need for the changes we're seeing around us. #LeenaLifeLessons

name: Leena Nair Unilever

text: You can put a lot of shiny tools in an organisation. So what? They're not going to get any traction unless people adapt to them, integrate them into the way they work. The human spirit, human essence, human connection can't be forgotten in a world where technology is all around

text: Often HR labels"high potentials" as a shortcut to develop one set of people. Without labels, it's hard work. But I believe everybody deserves the opportunity for development. So come on HR, do the hard work. Invest in every person in a thoughtful way! #LeenaLifeLessons #HR

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @LeenaNairHR So many leaders (especially those promoted from technical roles) often said to us, I do my managerial work at night'. Like this was an add on to thier job, a tick box exercise. Leading is the job!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: Yes! This is why I tell HR to walk with swagger. People ARE the business and HR leaders need to step up and see themselves as business leaders. In this age of technology, the soft stuff is the new Hard Stuff.//t.co/9TJMG8IrZX

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @ManishPajan @hrnext Yes! This is why I tell HR to walk with swagger. People ARE the business and HR leaders need to step up and see themselves as business leaders. In this age of technology, the soft stuff is the new Hard Stuff.

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @ajay_venkatesh1 This is one reason we got rid of box-ticking for our managers. We empowered them to manage their own people, and gave them more time to do it.

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: @ChrissieEco I have a friend who had been promoted in her company and was spending all her time in meetings or managing. She said "when do I have time to do my actual job?" I had to tell her "this IS your job!" Sometimes it can take people a while to adjust!

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: How do we think about change? 1. Disruptive something to be feared? 2. A catalyst for positive transformation? I choose 2. I'm optimistic about what change holds for the future and excited to see how it can enhance our lives and empower us at work. #WednesdayWisdom

name: Leena Nair Unilever

name: Leena Nair Unilever
text: Wow! Where did the last 35 years go? Time has flown. I've had the pleasure of working with super people in Unilever & beyond. name: Leena Nair Unilever
